result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett R. Rees was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Intent. Imp. Animal Shelter-Ventilation, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge and specimen were waived based on date of violation.

No possession of any animals except the two cats that currently reside with the defendant. The defendant may sell the Chinchillas as outlined by the terms of the probation agent. The Chinchillas to be sold within 60 days. 
Follow any Family or Juvenile or Family court order. 
Attend Parenting Class.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling or any other condition deemed appropriate by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for use at agent's discretion. Agent to determine with or without non-working hours if imposed.
Defendant to perform 100 Hours, total for both counts as a condition of probation, as directed by agent. To be structured towards benefiting animals.

Order for Reimbursement at Attorney Fees.

Affidavit of Services Rendered filed by Atty Murray.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Garrett R. Rees in court with attorney Daniel P. Murray.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 and Count #4,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts #2, 3 and 5 are dismissed and read in. 
Count #1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS JAIL;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No possession of any animals, with the exception of the two cats that currently reside with the Defendant.
*Any other condition deemed appropriate by agent.
*Community Service: Perform 100 Hours Total for Both Counts 
(structured towards benefiting animals). 
*Follow any family or juvenile or family court order.
*The Defendant may sell the Chinchilla's as outlined by the terms of the probation agent.  The chinchilla's to be sold within 60 days. 
*Attend parenting class. 

RESTITUTION:  Set at zero.

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE/SAMPLE: Waived based on date of violation. 

CONDITION TIME: 30 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  


Count #4:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

6 MONTHS JAIL; (consecutive to Count #1)

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
See Count #1

RESTITUTION:  Set at zero.

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE/SAMPLE: Waived based on date of violation.
